Title:
Two novel species of Botryosphaeria causing stem canker of
blueberries
Abstract:
Botryosphaeria spp. are endophytes, saprobes or plant
pathogens, which mostly associated with woody hosts. Here we initiate a
series of studies on botryosphaeriacous fungi associated with
blueberries . As a result, two new species of Botryosphaeria causing
blueberries stem canker, namely B. longispermatia and B. fujianensis,
are described and illustrated in southern China. Phylogenetic analysis
based on combined ITS, LSU, tef1-α and TUB loci support its separation
from all other species of Botryosphaeria. Morphological characteristics
are also distinguishable from those phylogenetic related species. Kochs
postulates tests indicated that both B. longispermatia and B.
fujianensis caused stem canker of blueberries.
